Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Anklet
Description: A row of disc-shaped beads cut from ostrich eggshells that adorned the ankle of the deceased. Numerous pieces of jewellery of this type are presented. Ostrich eggshell was a material highly appreciated by ancient Nubian peoples. For a long time, the animal lived in the Nubian desert, as is witnessed by its appearance in rock art and vase decorations.
